org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver
Class ClientHandler.InputHandler

java.lang.Object
  org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver.ClientHandler.InputHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
Enclosing class:
ClientHandler
private class ClientHandler.InputHandler
extends Object
implements Runnable

Listens to client and converts input to objects of type ClientMessageToServer. A thread is being used for this, since reading input is blocking, meaning the thread 'sleeps' while waiting for input. These messages are then added to the client messages queue for execution by external user.
Note: some messages are filtered by the server as they are of server level, such as pong messages.

Reuses fields from ClientHandler, such as ClientHandler.clientContext and ClientHandler.server. Keeps listening for input while the server is still running and the client hasn't timed out.

Since:
1.0
Author:
Benny Bottema

Constructor Detail

ClientHandler.InputHandler

private ClientHandler.InputHandler()
Method Detail

run

public void run()
Thread method that waits for input on the client Socket. Keeps waiting for input while the server is running and no PingPong timeout has occurred or the client has gone away.

The input data is read per line, so messages need to end with a newline character '\n'. Since clients need to conform to the common denominator, they are required to append a zero (0) byte '\0' as per Flash clients. This character is appended to the newline '\n' character and needs to be discarded manually using a BufferedReader.read().

Specified by:
run in interface Runnable
See Also:
SwiftSocketServer.isRunning(), ClientHandler.checkPong()

handleMessage

public void handleMessage(ClientContext clientContext,
                          String datagramMessage)
Handles a single client message string. Creates a ClientMessageToServer and adds this to the server message queue unless it is a server level message, such as a 'pong' notification, in which case the message is executed directly.

Parameters:
clientContext - The client that sent the message being interpreted.
datagramMessage - The client message string, minus newline character '\n' or zero (0) byte '\0'.
See Also:
createDecodedExecutableMessage(ClientContext, String), SwiftSocketServer.addClientMessage(ClientMessageToServer)

createDecodedExecutableMessage

protected ClientMessageToServer<?> createDecodedExecutableMessage(ClientContext clientContext,
                                                                  String clientMessage)
Parses the raw client message into a message id and message content. Passes both values to createDecodedExecutableMessage(ClientContext, int, String) and returns the result. The first three bytes of the raw message denote the message code.

In case anything goes wrong, a ClientMessageToServerInvalid object is returned instead which generates some useful message for logging purposes. The server user can choose to filter out unknown messages at its own discretion. If a ClientMessageToServerInvalid is executed however, it will throw a runtime exception with the original message.

Parameters:
clientMessage - The client input string that represents a single message.
Returns:
createDecodedExecutableMessage(ClientContext, int, String)
See Also:
createInvalidMessage(String, Exception, String)

createDecodedExecutableMessage

private final ClientMessageToServer<?> createDecodedExecutableMessage(ClientContext clientContext,
                                                                      int messageId,
                                                                      String messageContent)
Creates a ClientMessageToServer instance based on the message id and message content.

Parameters:
clientContext - The client that sent the message, useful to be able to reply to.
messageId - The identifier for the message type we need to instantiate.
messageContent - The message content for the solved message type to decode.
Returns:
A ClientMessageToServer with identified by messageId decoded from messageContent.
See Also:
SwiftSocketServer.getClientMessageToServerType(int), ClientMessageToServer.decode(String)

createInvalidMessage

private ClientMessageToServer<?> createInvalidMessage(String originalMessage,
                                                      Exception failureCause,
                                                      String cause)
Generates a ClientMessageToServerInvalid object with the failure cause. When executed, this message throws a runtime exception with the original exception.

Parameters:
originalMessage - The original message
failureCause - The exception that occurred when the original messages was being converted into a ClientMessageToServer.
cause - A fine grained exception description when the exception failureCause occurred.
Returns:
An instance of ClientMessageToServerInvalid.
